arts.ttl: Stevenage end winless run by beating struggling Shrewsbury
Clean sheet, win and better performance as Stevenage win at Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: A Kyle Edwards goal handed them a 1-0 win at Shrewsbury Town and after the dismal displays of late, this was a tonic that was needed and delightful to see. Both sides struck the post, Shrews twice to Boro's one, while the home side also had a goal ruled out for offside.

arts.ttl: Ollie Westbury comment: Which Shrewsbury Town players have improved the most under Gareth Ainsworth?
arts.sum: To do that, he has had to improve the players he has had at his disposal - but which of Town's current squad have benefitted the most from Ainsworth's appointment? The head coach was appointed in November, and in the three months which have followed, Salop have improved immeasurably.

Shrewsbury have been unable to take advantage of three home games on the bounce having suffered defeats to Bolton and Huddersfield already this week. Fortunately, the Shrews are still within touching...

arts.ttl: Defiant David Wheeler speaks for the first time since signing for Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: "I am a hard-working player, and I think those attributes help in multiple different positions, which is probably why I have played up front, centre of midfield and at wing-back. Speaking in his first interview as a Town player, he gave his take on the possibility of third-tier survival this campaign.

arts.ttl: Chelsea loanee injury diagnosis revealed amid blow to Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: Shrewsbury have not given up on seeing the youngster in blue and amber again this season - there is a hope if he can recover in time, he might be able to play some part in their last few games of the campaign. Town head coach Gareth Ainsworth said the youngster has been suffering from an 'overuse' injury which now turns out to be a stress fracture after further investigation.
